proposal.title: Make Joystream Great Again!
proposal.description:
In order for the new platform we need an active council. This means that they are active, and vote on the incoming proposals.

For that reason, I'm making one to test the waters.
details:
Now, as part of the KPI, you are asked to deal with incoming proposals, and open discussions in the forum. A proper discussion module has already been built, but it's not part of the UI yet. Therefore, the forum will act as a placeholder in the meantime.

Jsgenesis will make proposals from time to time, but the idea is for the community themselves to make them. Some things that needs to be taken care of:

#### Storage Provider Parameters:
These were set to a low number, and with low pay. 
- How many does the platform need? 
- How much should they earn?
- How much should they stake?
- etc.

Up to you.

#### Set Curator Lead
Currently, the lead is part of the Jsgenesis team, but this needs to be rectified, as we will not hire anyone.
- Who should be the lead?
- Why?

Up to you.

#### Action
To make everyone a little richer, feel free to slash me :D

If this proposal was made by anyone else, I hope you instead discuss it, and vote in a timely and fair manner.

proposal.title: Forum Timestamp Upgrade
proposal.description: It would bring some perspective on whether the post, comment or a thread is old or new.

proposal.title: Reqs for creating new forum categories
proposal.description:
So that the forum is not spammed with too many categories, I'm proposing that the requirements are:

### Text proposal required
* Creating a new forum category
* Removing/archiving a forum category

### No proposal required / Forum sudo personal judgement
* Creating a subcategory
* Removing a subcategory

I think this provides some balance in the way the forums are managed for the time being, and if needs be we can change this later.
If accepted, anyone seeking a new forum category should create a text proposal which describes the use of the forum category.

proposal.title: Improve the Joystream Community Repo
proposal.description:
As the community repo has been somewhat neglected, I'm creating this proposal for feedback on the a [PR](https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/7) I've made.

Unless the community prefers another approach, I would like the community to review the PR, agree on the improvements needed at a high level, then assign the task of implementing the improvements to one or more users.
details:
Once the above is decided:
- Pull in [this branch](https://github.com/bwhm/community-repo/tree/organize)
- Make the changes
- Create a new PR in line with the (new and improved) workflow
- Create a proposal, that includes a reward distribution

Once approved by both the community and Jsgenesis, the new PR will get merged, and Jsgenesis will pay a $100 reward (in tJOY), distributed as described in the proposal.

Then, all currently open PRs must be changed to fit in the new structure. Each PR merged receives a $10 reward (in tJOY).
- The initial user gets 48h to pull new master, modify, and push.
- After that, anyone can claim the reward

Feel free to make suggestions that goes past the basics in the PR. If they are good, extra rewards may be in place!

proposal.title: Make validator rewards great again!
proposal.description:
Although the new incentive scheme has, in our view, been an improvement overall, the `Validator` role has not worked out the way we expected. As the validators simply aren't rewarded enough to cover costs, we're proposing some ways of increasing it.

It's become clear that most users are not familiar with how the validators rewards works, and how it's calculated. For some context on what is being proposed and why, go [here](https://github.com/Joystream/helpdesk/tree/master/roles/validators#rewards).

There are many ways of increasing the rewards, but a good place to start would be to increase the `slotsStake`. The first attempt of doing so was to create more competition for the open slots, as seen in [KPI #5.2](https://blog.joystream.org/constantinople-kpis/#five). The Council lowered the amount of slots from 20 to 12 through [proposal #25](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/25), but the effects were rather small.
details:
Increase the `slotStake` by doubling all `validator` rewards for a week.

Jsgenesis will manually double the rewards paid out to validators for the next 100800 blocks (7 days) from the time this proposal is executed. The extra rewards will not be minted, but rather come from our backup stash, and not decrease the value of tJOY.

Although this seems like only a short term fix, if this results in doubling the `slotStake`, and users keep validating/nominating after the end of the period, the actual rewards will remain twice as high afterwards. 

As seen in the link explainer link above, the LOWEST stake of the validators are the easiest way to achieve increased rewards. Conveniently, if you want to earn more tokens by nominating, you will earn more tokens by nominating the active validator(s) with the lowest stake (all else being equal).

posts.text: Well we agreed to keep it at 2.5mil but since we can only refill 1mil at a time there has to be multiple proposals. It is just for the rewards yes. We are currently not having any active KPI's. And rewards could probably be lowered. However even if we halve them it would still require refilling it every 4-6 days I believe. You are correct, currently there isn't much to do. But the role hiring was made during a KPI for content creation and there was a big spike in content creation that had to be curated. So that was our basis for the reward amount. If you feel like it's too much you can create a proposal and we can come to a mutual agreement!

Thanks for the clarification. To clarify, my opinion does not matter in of itself, you should run this as you see fit, I am just asking to understand. Its our job to build this to support your ability to solve your problems, but that requires that we understand what is going on ;) With limited resources, my guess would have been that you would not bother spending money on something that does not yield a return, i.e. has a KPI, as curation currently does not.

proposal.title: Runtime Upgrade as sudo/root
proposal.description:
As [proposal #38](https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/38) failed to get approved before the council term expired, Jsgenesis wishes to make the runtime upgrade via sudo.

Unfortunately, we could not get the required threshold in time, with one vote missing. 
The current implementation of the proposal has a bug where the votes of the "old" council doesn't carry over to the next council (by design), but any CMs that are re-elected can not cast their vote again. This means it's impossible to get the required votes. As we wanted the proposal to pass within reasonable hours in Europe somewhere between the 27th and 29th of July, we are requesting permission from the council to step around the governance process.
details:
This runtime upgrade changes the storage system, as the storage providers becomes a working group, with a lead for hiring and firing, a mint for their budget, and an upgrade to the storage node itself. Secondary effects of this is that some new proposals (regarding hiring and firing of the storage lead and a storage mint replinishment) and removing some old ones regarding storage providers.

This requires some attention, in particular the following tasks must be performed by us:
- update hosted pioneer
- migrate the content directory
- deploy temporary storage-nodes
- support

We therefore ask for permission to deploy the new runtime on the 29th of July 2020, somewhere between 1300 and 1500 GMT (roughly between blocks 1913800 and 1915000).
To sweeten the deal, we will add another $250 to the pool if accepted!

proposal.title: Refill council mint
proposal.description:
The council mint needs to be refilled periodically, this is done by Jsgenesis.
The council mint pays out council member payments and all approved spending proposals that the council has voted on.

This proposal requests that the mint is filled to 2 million tokens which should cover about a week. If any significant spending proposals come in, the mint will need to be adjusted accordingly.

proposal.title: Proposal to "Overhaul" the KPI System
proposal.description:
After 11 weeks of KPIs, we at Jsgenesis are of the impression it's not working the way we had hoped. Though there are many smaller issues that may have contributed to the failure of the current system, we think the biggest problem is simply that incentives for KPIs are not calibrated correctly.

As the KPIs reward all token holders based on their proportional share of the tJOY issuance, it would only makes financial sense for true "whales" to participate, without a substantially larger fiat pool. Even then, the "free-rider problem" could come in to play.

Our hope was that these issues would be mitigated through funding proposals and competition for Council spots, but that has proved to be incorrect.

Our main objective for the KPI system continues to be attracting and training contributors to the project, while simulating the economic system we envision the mainnet platform will run on. At this stage, all improvements to the platform (in the form of development, marketing, content creation etc.) will need to be funded and executed by the platform independently.

It is to serve this ultimate goal that we have suggested some enhancements to the KPI system.
details:
An executive summary of our proposal to improve the system are as follows:

- KPIs will be split in to "Council KPIs" and "Community KPIs".
- Council KPIs:
  - These KPIs will typically focus on short terms goals, like network stability, platform operations and allocation of resources.
  - They will always follow the Council term (i.e. they will last for seven days)
  - The rewards for achieved Council KPIs will be distributed to the Council and their backers (voters) only.
- Community KPIs:
  - These KPIs will typically be producing a deliverable or performing some task for the community or Jsgenesis.
  - These can be more long-term oriented, and require more work and some skills in a specific domain.
  - The reward structure will work similar to todays KPI system, but with a clear workflow, and with Jsgenesis providing a guarantee for the contributors.
- Both of these KPI types will require more involvement from the Council, thus requiring better incentives for them to be active.
- Jsgenesis will take a more involved in the election cycle, to avoid complacency and "free-riders".

More details can be found [here](https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/issues/9). Questions and comments are welcome :)

proposal.title: Use Forum as primary community platform
proposal.description: We have an on-chain forum tied to memberships to build an immutable record of the contribution and participation of members over time. This is an important way to build reputation and credibility on the platform for the future. The Jsgenesis team has, and will always continue to, preserve the history of the forum as we make further runtime upgrades or new chain, in order to preserve this history. To further encourage such use of the forum to build social capital over time, we should encourage use of the forum over any other temporary platforms, such as Github. The profiles on Github are not even clearly bound to platform memberships. Now that we have the Telegram bot, and the forum surfaces recent activity more clearly, its also much better suited to play this role. Further use of the forum will help us to identify other improvements which will be needed for it to suit the needs of the community as we move forward.
details: All issues, proposals, bugs or similar from the community should be redirected from Github to the on-chain forum.

posts.text:
In general, I agree that "focusing" all communication regarding current and short term network related discussion in one place is important. The forum, as it stands today, is not really suitable, but raising the character limit is a good first step.

We were in the process of doing this, but due to summer holiday for some of our team members, it would be a bit risky to do now IMO. If we simply stick to that one thing for now, I think it could be done next week, but if we want to include some of the other changes mentioned [here](https://github.com/Joystream/joystream/issues/1121), it would take a little more time.

Regarding your specific example @bedeho, those kinds of discussions would certainly be good to have on the forum.

proposal.title: Council Secretary Application
proposal.description:
I'm applying for the council secretary position with this proposal. This was discussed here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/87?replyIdx=5
This is described as a reoccurring role, so I will be applying for 2 million tokens per week as my payment (~$80). I may adjust this based on token value but will create a proposal for this adjustment if its a significant change.
My duties will include:
- Representing the council on the community repo
- Creating threads for council reports + tokenomics reports
- Creating threads for KPIs
- Communicating via Telegram when proposals require votes or the council needs to perform certain actions

The council reports + tokenomics reports can still be created by other community members who can use spending proposals to fund the creation of these documents, I will just be managing them. If I create the actual proposals I may apply for funding for these.

proposal.title: KPI 12.5 - Determine New KPI Structure
proposal.description:
This is overdue for any KPI reward, but needs to be submitted. This post is created based on the contributions of forum posts, github posts and proposal comments.
Overall the feedback on the forum and initial proposal (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/issues/9, https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/50 & https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/84) was positive, I didn't see anyone ask for any specific changes to how the system would work.

Overall I didn't see any requested changes specific to the structure of what was presented by Jsgenesis, but there were a few suggestions:

### Some suggested changes / additions:
- Require applying CMs to create an introduction post on the forum with their Telegram username, and basic information before applying for a role.
- Perhaps make part of CM incentives be based on a CMs input to the council report after the council round has ended as input in this area has been lacking. This would help to create a better standard of feedback.
- A smaller council size. Some people were against this and some people were for this idea, but it may be worth experimenting with and might help to better standardize the council processes while we are in these early stages of the project.

If this proposal is approved I will work on creating a PR on Github with these additions.

proposal.title: Council #19 Budget
proposal.description:
As discussed on this thread https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/95 the council will need to begin working with budgets, this is the first attempt at implementing some form of budget.
It is not a binding document for now, but with council reports will begin to give us some idea of what the council is spending and will guide Jsgenesis on what the mint should be set at.
It will also allow the council to advertise part of these funds as being available for spending proposals, for now this is 50% of the weeks KPI bonuses, but we can increase or decrease this amount based on performance and demand.
As time progresses we can improve this greatly, but as a start this budget is fairly simple.

# Current Obligations
* Council Member Payments
	* 20k tokens per 3600 blocks for 57.6k blocks (currently 10 members)
	* 3.2 million tokens per council round
* Council roles
	* Council Secretary
		* 2 million tokens per council round

# KPI rewards
* $700 total (does not include weekly replenishment)
	* half of this amount is $350 in tokens at current rate of 0.0000414
	* 8454106 tokens

# Budget overview for Council #19
* Obligations
	* 5200000 tokens
* Available for spending proposals
	* 8454106 tokens
Total 
* 13,654,106 tokens

proposal.title: Changing the Council Election Parameters
proposal.description:
As discussed on both the forum and other proposals, we want to change the KPI structure. A key component of this relies on having competition for the Council spots, as we will require more from them.

We intentionally chose a long grace period (~2 weeks) for the `Set Election Parameters` proposal, as we didn't want the Council to be able to rig the game in their favor. For this reason, we request permission to make this changes as root, although it's not in the spirit of the Council...
details:
No specific changes will be made without a "formal" proposal outlining the exact numbers. The below are just ranges, for you to consider:

- `Council Size`: 4-8 CMs
- `Announcing Period`: 1 or 2 days
- `Voting Period`: 1 or 2 days
- `Revealing Period`: 1 or 2 days
- `New Term Duration`: 1 or 2 weeks (incl voting/reveal)

The rest of the numbers are less impactful...

Again, these will not be made without a warning, any input is welcome :)

proposal.title: Council Budget
proposal.description:
This is a little overdue as I was waiting for the council secretary proposal to pass.

# Council #20/#21 Budget

As discussed on this thread https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/95 the council will need to begin working with budgets, this is the second attempt at implementing some form of budget, the first budget is here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/59 which has also been implemented in the council reports (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/74)

It is not a binding document for now, but with council reports will begin to give us some idea of what the council is spending and will guide Jsgenesis on what the mint should be set at. It will also allow the council to advertise part of these funds as being available for spending proposals, for now this is 50% of the weeks KPI bonuses, but we can increase or decrease this amount based on performance and demand. As time progresses we can improve this greatly, but as a start this budget is fairly simple.

## Current Obligations
* Council Member Payments
	* 	
* Council roles
	* Council Members
		* 20k tokens per 3600 blocks for 57.6k blocks (currently 10 members)
		* 3.2 million tokens per council round
	* Council Secretary
		* 2 million tokens per council round
* Potential KPI rewards
	* $550 total (does not include weekly replenishment)
		* 50% of this is $225 (5184331 tokens @ $0.0000434 exchange rate)

## Budget overview
* Obligations
	* 5200000 tokens
* Available for spending proposals
	* 5184331 tokens
* Total
	* 10384331 tokens

proposal.title: Curator working group feedback - August
proposal.description:
As part of KPI 15.5 the council is expected to evaluate the performance and resource use of the storage and curator working groups for the month of August
Please use the discussion section of this proposal to discuss the performance of the content working group.

This includes:
* The quality of featured videos
* Whether appropriate channels are verified
* Whether explicit videos are marked appropriately
* Whether unplayable videos are removed

This feedback will be incorporated in a template and added to another proposal for final approval (https://github.com/Joystream/community-repo/pull/15/commits/1c39047b597e053e5861a3e00b4bd31ca6690b80)

Information about the current role, and the lead are located here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/working-groups

There is also a forum subcategory for the role here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/categories/15

proposal.title: Council #22 Budget
proposal.description:
As discussed on this thread https://testnet.joystream.org/#/forum/threads/95 the council will need to begin working with budgets, this is the second attempt at implementing some form of budget, the first budget is here: https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/59 which has also been implemented in the council reports (https://testnet.joystream.org/#/proposals/74)

It is not a binding document for now, but with council reports will begin to give us some idea of what the council is spending and will guide Jsgenesis on what the mint should be set at. It will also allow the council to advertise part of these funds as being available for spending proposals, for now this is 50% of the weeks KPI bonuses, but we can increase or decrease this amount based on performance and demand. As time progresses we can improve this greatly, but as a start this budget is fairly simple.

## Current Obligations
* Council roles
Council Members (20k tokens per 3600 blocks for 57.6k blocks (currently 10 members) 3.2 million tokens per council round)
Council Secretary (2 million tokens per council round)

Potential KPI rewards
$550 total (does not include weekly replenishment)
50% of this is $225 (5079006 tokens @ $0.0000443 exchange rate)

## Budget overview
Obligations = 5200000 tokens
Available for spending proposals = 5079006 tokens
Total = 10279006 tokens

proposal.title: New values for the "Alexandria"
proposal.description:
As mentioned in KPI 17.5, and in previous proposals, we are making some changes for the new network.
Some are simply on the community side, whereas others are chain parameters.
details:
## Chain parameters
### Validators
Upgrading to a more recent version of [substrate](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate) forces some changes on the validator configuration. Others are made purposefully, in the hopes that this position will be more lucrative:

The major "forced" changes from the upgrade are that:

- Instead of the least staked validator (`slotStake`) capping rewards, it is now the sum of total stakes of all validators+nominators.

As rewards are calculated based on the stake/issuance ratio, this should drastically increase rewards.

- Payouts to validators are **not** paid automatically

However, you have two weeks to claim your rewards, so if your forget for 15 days, you'll only "lose" a day. (Also, anyone can claim for anyone, so a nominator will not suffer if the validator forgets)

- Slashing has changed

If less than 10% of the max allowed validators goes down in an `era` (1h), they will get booted, but not slashed.
Also, the magnitude of a slash is much lower, and capped at 7% for validators that simply drop, whereas we previously could see up to 40%. (Double signing, and trying to pass "fake" blocks can still see much higher slashes).

**Min yearly inflation**
From 2.5% to 5% -> Effectively doubling the baseline reward for validators.

**Max yearly inflation**
From 30% to 75% -> So they can earn a decent living :)

**Ideal staking ratio**
From 30% to 25% -> Meaning that rewards for the validators grows linearly from 5% (with 0% of issuance staked) to 75% (with 25% of issuance staked).

Combined, these three should make being a validator significantly more profitable. Note that none of these values above can be changed by the Council, but a runtime upgrade will.

**Max validators**
From 12 to 20 -> This was reduced because of the `slotStake` problem. In time, we may want to see the council raise this further!

### Forum max char
From 1000 to 3000 -> Requested feature :D

### Council

The council will get a lot more responsibilities. We will also be more involved in voting in the "right" candidates.

**Council size**
From 10 to 6 -> This will ensure the Council always has a large ratio of qualified members.

**Council term**
From 100800 blocks (7 days) to 201600 blocks (14 days) -> Giving them more time to address issues.

## Other Changes

**Council rewards**
1. Recurring rewards from ~USD 15/term to ~USD 60/term
2. KPI rewards go to CMs and those that voted for them only.

We are going to target making the max KPI rewards for the Council at ~USD 500 a term.

*Example*
CM_N is Council Member N
V_N is Voter N
**Note that Jsgenesis votes will not "count"**

---

Suppose:
- CM_1:5k
  - own:2k
  - V_1:3k
- CM_2:5k
  - own:5k
- CM_3:11k
  - own:4k
  - V_1:2.5k
  - V_2:4.5k
CM_4,5,6=CM_X
- CM_X:3k
  - own:3k
Total: 30k

At the end of their term, the KPI payout was USD300. Half of that is split equally (150/6=25), half is divided by stake.

- CM_1: `(60+25+(150*2/30))=95`
- CM_2: `(60+25+(150*5/30))=110`
- CM_3: `(60+25+(150*4/30))=105`
- CM_X: `(60+25+(150*3/30))=100`
- V_1:  `150*(3+2.5)/30=27.5`
- V_1:  `150*4.5/30=22.5`
-> USD660

---

Note that the KPI rewards will be based on the exchange rate at the START of the Councils term.
The weekly "Recurring Rewards", will act as a constraint on the Councils budget. If they overspend, their KPI rewards will go down in value. Assuming the exchange rate drops 20%, the KPI reward of USD300 will instead be USD240.

When a KPI is paid out (in tJOY), the equivalent amount will be added to the fiat pool.

### Bounties
We are leaning towards using the term `Bounties` instead of `Community KPIs` as referred to previously.
Nevertheless:
- the Council will manage them as part of their KPIs
- the (potential) rewards will go the individual or group that performed the work
- if the bounty pays USD50, and is approved by the Council, but Jsgenesis only grades it half complete (thus USD25), the Council will have the difference deducted from their KPI rewards.
